item.title: My 4-monitor computer setup (16-inches + 49-inches + 34-inches + 24-inches) - Alexey Guzey
item.description:
Also see: Tools / Gear I use more monitors than any of my friends, the reasoning being approximately: if things fall out of my head when I don’t see them, why not just see all of them? Here’s a video that goes into the detail of my setup and explains how exactly I use every monitor:
Video’s table of contents: Introduction 0.1. 0:00 overview 0.2. 0:25 Worker League phone app (coded by Misha Yagudin) 0.3. 1:08 my standing desk that destroyed my roof 1:48 a 16-inch laptop …

item.title: S06E12 - nanoFramework: Unleashing the Power of C# in Embedded Systems and IoT with José Simões
item.description: José Simões explores the .NET nanoFramework, a powerful platform for embedded systems and IoT development. Discover how this stripped-down version of the .NET Framework empowers developers to create applications for resource-constrained devices, while abstracting away the complexities of working with microcontrollers. Gain insights on the platform's unique features, such as productivity enhancements, code reusability, and seamless migration. Whether you're a seasoned developer or just starting out in the world of embedded systems, this podcast offers valuable insights and inspiration for leveraging the .NET nanoFramework in your projects

item.title: What Is a Modular Monolith?
item.description: Modular monoliths blend the simplicity and robustness of traditional monolithic applications with the flexibility and scalability of microservices. Today, I'll introduce you to the modular monolith architecture and why you should know about it.
